intro: Hieracium adenotontum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium adenotontum is an annual or biennial plant, and it can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
